New Records: South Africa's worst ever start to a T20 international at 3/3
Key Match Events: David Miller was South Africa's hero as they defeated Netherlands by four wickets with seven balls remaining, finishing on 106/6
Marco Jansen finished with figures of 2/20 off his four overs and also took two catches
Anrich Nortje removed Bas de Leede with a catch from David Miller
Scott Edwards' reverse-scoop six off Nortje was a notable shot
Baartman concluded the day with figures of 4/11, with Logan van Beek caught by Nortje
South Africa got their run chase of 104 off to the worst possible start, losing four wickets in the first five overs
De Kock was run out in the very first ball
Reeza Hendricks was bowled by Van Beek in the second over for just 3
Captain Markram edged a Kingma ball to the gloves of Edwards, leaving South Africa on 3/3
Klaasen made 4 before sending a shot flying into the hands of Pringle in the deep
Stubbs fell in the 17th over for 33, caught by Van Beek from a De Leede delivery
Jansen was bowled by an angled delivery from Van Beek
Miller hit two sixes and a four in the 19th over to take South Africa over the line
Pre-Game Insights: Aiden Markram opted to put Netherlands in to bat in New York in the Group D game
Both teams named an unchanged side from their opening encounters in Group D, when South Africa beat Sri Lanka by six wickets, and Netherlands beat Nepal, also by six wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium, New York in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup
